newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait urges caution after child rape.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait urges caution after child rape.

text.p: Kuwait advised parents against leaving children with domestic help after a 3-1/2 year-old boy was raped by a family driver, an Interior Ministry statement said on Sunday.
"This vicious crime...is the responsibility of trusting, lenient parents...who fail to monitor the behaviour of domestic servants and drivers," the statement said.
A ministry official said no further details on the rape case were immediately available.
The statement criticised parents who grant domestic help "the right to care for their children, leaving them with (servants) in the absence of a social role for the family."
The ministry urged parents against leaving children alone with servants "to avoid exposing them to such acts".

It is common for Kuwaitis and many foreign residents in the oil-rich state to hire domestic help and drivers. There are more than 200,000 people employed as domestic workers in Kuwait which has a population of about two million.
